If you are wondering why I wrote almost, it's because the soda was the only thing that tasted good there. When you order spicy food, it is sour and salty. Anything you can order there, you can make it at home at a much cheaper price and most likely even healthier or you can go to another restaurant that is cheaper and better tasting.
author: Timothy K.

description: My mouth waters when I remember Muragame Udon. It's heaven on earth. We have eaten at the Waikiki one at least a dozen times so when we heard one opened in SF during one of our trips we made a pit stop. The wait was over an hour but we were determined and starving. They're still getting some kinks ironed out after all they had just had a soft opening but overall the food was exactly how it tastes in Waikiki. The only sad part was no spam masubi. My husband shed a tear over that. I do love how the toppings bar is in the center and DIY versus the Waikiki one where u have to smile sweetly and hope they don't judge for asking for extra onion crispies and green onions. Haha. Love you Muragame hope to see u again soon!
author: mare r.

description: The udon is pretty good! I also love how you add whatever you want onto your udon as well. The bonus for me was also that they sell onigiri. The wait was not too bad also. Maybe the wait was like 15 minutes. The workers were nice, energetic, and fast! Great service here too for my first time.
author: Erica L.

description:
It's been well past their soft opening and there's still a line! The line wrapped around twice and it took maybe 20-25 minutes to make it through doors and into the warmth of the restaurant. For those of you that have never had udon, my bf describes it as "not as bland as pho, but not as flavorful as ramen." So there you have it. 
We both ordered the been udon and had one extra topping each which set us back about $10/bowl. Not too shabby. Definitely nice on a cold or rainy day.
author: Betty T.

description: Best ever. Cheap and fresh. Just be careful when you go as the lines get ridiculous at peak hours. Can't get enough of this. Best to eat it!
author: Claire C.

description: Neat concept for ramen. It's cafeteria style and you order as you go down the line. The ramen is made fresh to order, but the udon was just so-so. It was over-cooked and is served lukewarm. I prefer my ramen steaming hot. I would say that the side dishes easily outshined the ramen. This would not be my first choice whenever I crave for ramen, especially when there are plenty other options in the City.
author: Calforever C.

description: This place is so delightful! I like how they have sizes available. I tried the egg flower drop, and the soup was a little thick, but other than that it was good! I like the udon noodles. This place has everything you need to eat udon noodles and tempura. I also tried the squid and shrimp tempura. The shrimp was very good and crispy and the squid was softer in texture, but overall good. I will be coming here again! It's also perfect since I'm a student at SFSU taking night classes, so it works for my nightly food cravings after class!
author: Joy M.

description: I didn't think I would like this place as much as I do. Cheap eats and great food. You can also splurge on sides if you're super hungry. The tuna onigiri are really good and the fried tamago too. Great place for people in a hurry or on a budget.
author: Alex H.

description:
You know it's good when you have it the day before and immediately crave it the day after! I've been to Marukame Udon in Hawaii and I've heard that this location is basically an extension but just with a different name. 
 Got there around 8:40 and waited in line for less than 20 minutes. It was pretty gloomy and just rained so maybe that's why we didn't wait very long. 
Compared to the Hawaii menu, there are a couple differences. Just from what I remember, I know that Hawaii's location doesn't have the mentai option and I believe the edamame salsa? I personally went with #2, the Nikutama, but I wish I got the mentai. As for the tempura and onigiri, there was a good variety so I'd say it's almost the same just from the top of my head. I got shrimp tempura, zucchini, and the mentai mayo onigiri which was soooooooo good and the reason why I wish I got the mentai udon. Love that there's a little station where you can add your own green onions, tempura flakes, ginger, and tempura sauce! 
Would I recommend? Definitely! It was so good and reminded me of the Hawaii Location with a couple of new standouts. Only thing I would note is that the seating is cafeteria style and there's really no way to know when you'll get seats unless you stay near a table and wait for it to be empty. Planning to go to the LA location now since the menu is a little different there too!
author: Athina Louise L.

description: the grab as much as you want tempura and other knick knacks bar was the highlight of my experience - be blessed future visitor
author: Erika J.

description: Such an affordable price for good quality udon! Loved the atmosphere and I went when there wasn't a long line but beware there usually is but it's worth it!
author: Spenta M.

description: My only complaint is be prepared to wait ---- outside ! Bring a jacket bc it gets chilly. Beside that amazing food. Great choices. Great prices. A little dirty but seeing how busy it is , I can understand.
author: Alyson T.

description: This place is so delicious and the best part is they're so clean. The curry was so flavorful and the spicy chicken udon was just the right spicy. And everybody loves tempura
author: Amani K.

description: Wonderful experience. Unlike the regular ramen or Japanese restaurants I have been to, Marugame is more like a Chipotle style. You stand in line and grab the kind of udon that you want and then you will pick the tempuras or the musubi before paying at the cashier. Udon is great. We ordered the one with the poached egg and beef, definitely worth trying. The only downside is that you will have to spend at least twenty minutes or more to wait in line regardless what time you go. Nonetheless, this place is worth going and we will definitely be back to try other food on their menu.
author: Harry L.

description: This is an awesome store. I love the soup and noddle. I only waited 20mins and get in. I love it so much. I can't wait for the next time.
author: Yongyu C.

description: All I gotta say is: the noodles. The noodles are worth the soft-opening-hype-wait. Sure the broth and the optional tempura were good too (koroke and the veggie ball especially), but the noodles are what sets this place apart.
author: Susie K.

description: This place just opened, so it's a fairly long wait but worth it. I waited about an hour in line and gobbled up the noodles in less than 20mins! Comparable to the one I had in Honolulu named "Marukame"
author: Cindy C.

description:
Been a fan of the chain ever since I went to the one in Waikiki.  The food is still solid and reasonably priced.  It doesn't quite match the Hawaii locations, but it was close enough!

Admittedly, the food could have been slightly warmer on this cold day, but it was still good for what it was.
author: Benjamin C.

description: I've never had udon like this place. At marugame, they make their noodles very delicious and fresh. The broth is simple, yet flavorful. And the side dishes are to die for. I never leave the line without a musubi or potato croquet.
author: Susan S.

description: Pretty good place for fresh udon. Went here on a rainy day but got lucky the line wasn't too bad. I ordered the egg drop chicken udon while my cousins ordered the kake udon which was just the broth and udon. Tempura bar to select what you desire- veggies, shrimp etc. There is also a complimentary condiment bar for you to complete the taste as you like.
author: Jasmine l.

description: Just my personal opinion but this place is way over hyped. I don't know if it was just the day we went or what but everything was extremely salty. We waited about 45 minutes in line so of course we were hungry and so ready to eat but sadly the udon and fried foods were all so salty. We got the curry udon, beef, and another one which I forgot what it's called. I was surprised everyone else's was salty too. I will probably give this place another try but honestly, not when it's busy (which is never)! The seating situation is terrible as well and stressful. So many people cramped to sit next to each other. It's a cute little place tho and love the atmosphere but after waiting in the cold, I just want my darn udon & a seat!
author: Grace H.

description: I was too curious about the long line every time I go stonestown. What's the hype? So I decided to go and check it out with my friend. Wait in the line for half an hour or maybe less since it was late at night ( sacrifice being out there freezing) . I love udon but it's just typical udon they have, nothing special. Price is okay, but if you hungry aft, just go get Chinese food, it's way better  or go somewhere and eat ramen!
author: JeHsz Z.

description:
Great service, but long lines. I usually get the Bukkake Udon with tempura shrimp. If you'd want to go for some more extravaganza, get the Nikutama which includes beef and a soft boiled egg.

This place is usually full, so the downside is that they will hold up the line when the seats are full and you'd have to wait to order until people leave the restaurant.

Overall, great udon (delicious and fresh) and crispy tempura goodness. (You can actually see them fry and coat their tempura in the back!)
author: Ivan L.

description: It is similar to the one in Hawaii! I was so excited to try it out during the soft opening! However, I waited at least one hour just to go in and eat. I order the beef udon and it didn't not disappoint! There are unlimited green to garnish!! I would go again but I want the hype to go down first.
author: Julie M.

description: Love this place. So good. Good thing they working out the kinks with a soft opening. The dude today putting together the bowls was at a snail's pace. Oblivious to the many people waiting. Come on, let's also import some Japanese efficiency as well please.
author: Billy S.

description: Overhyped, yes but there's really a reason for it. The line is so long, you just need to know the perfect timing on when to go so you don't have to wait that much (we went on Sunday afternoon started to be in line 215pmish, ended up in the table 3pm.) About the food: it's so amazing!!! Not to sound snob but I've been to Japan and tasted the real authentic Japanese udon and all I can say is this didn't disappoint me. I ordered the chicken egg drop, but they didn't have chicken anymore so they ended up subbing it with the beef, which is I can't complain!!! The taste is so right on the spot and the noodles are so perfectly and freshly cooked. It's so soft and very al dente. The tempuras are freshly made in front of you, so it's super crunchy and very tasty. Service is very fast and the place is clean. You can feel the authentic Japanese vibe while inside the restaurant. Overall is highly recommended!!! 4.5 just cuz of the wait.
author: Range B.

description: I probably wouldn't come here again. I'm not a fan of someone's hands being in my noodles and then throwing it in a bowl, slapping a mediocre broth on it. All the soups are basic AF. You're better off with PHO. The tempura was all crust no meat. The people working there just gave me bad vibes. Too young, one guy working there made a comment about the customers taking too long. Felt like I was at a bad Chipotle.
author: Sean V.

description: Long queue, the tempuras weren't hot, they were running out of the condiments, the place wasn't clean enough. Maybe because it was very busy at that time.
author: Alfona K.

description: Honestly its okay. Like 4 stars for the noodles but the tempura isn't good and isn't special at all. Service is okay during lunch times and workers are extremely chill but towards the night it gets REALLY crowded and takes like 1 hr wait.
author: Veronica L.

description: Best udon I've tried, the noodles are fresh, beef is tender and the tempura batter so crispy. My only com
author: Taryn M.

description: My experience was ok. I wish the broth was hot cause when we got our udon, the broth was just warm. Everything was very tasty but a little disappointed with the nori sandwich. It didn't have a lot of crab filling. It was mostly rice. I would still go back for the soup.
author: Rhina M.

description: This place is phoking awesome. Isn't a pho place fortunately (so many in sf almost been to them all). I came here with my friend from my old neighborhood in San Francisco. This place used to be "blue c sushi" never had gone cause it looked like a crap version of a sushi boat place in Japan town. My trashy ex roommate swore that this place was a good sushi place. But nonetheless I wasn't expecting this place to be as nice as it turned out to be. Awesome experience. After getting through the line that extends out of the storefront your greeted with an amazing smell of fresh noodles being prepared in front of you. I knew as soon as I saw this I was in good hands. They have a wide variety of soup options udon or ramen based with an unon noodle. I got the #5 and was so satisfied with it. I will forsure be back on a regular basis and can't wait to try all of the numbers plus some. They have some side options you can pick for yourself before you get the the cashier for checkout. 6 stars if that is an option! Yum!!!
author: Tofu S.

description: The Ramen is awesome! The service is impeccable, the wait time even on a busy night is do-able and there is the added perk of spending time in the mall.
author: Mle C.

description: The noodles makes this place. After a long wait I finally got to order. I was a bit annoyed because I got a coupon from the mail and for the first time I used one, I got to the cashier and she proceeded to ring me up then she told me that coupon for shrimp is for next month . It was ok but she said it so loudly and everyone started looking at us. I was so embarrassed and I just said whatever just ring me up so I could get out of this line. If I was her I would have said let me ask my manager about this. Then she told me you could use the coupon twice because your only one. I don't think so . I did not like the way she talked to me because I felt that  she was talking down to me. Customer Service Please.
author: Jolens V.

description: So glad I finally gave this place a chance and tried it out. I've always been stirred away at the sight of the line, but one day my bf and I stuck it out and just waited. It wasn't that long, the line moved pretty fast for what it was. We probably waited about 20 minutes. It was a bit chilly, but it was worth it! Inside, you order your choice of udon, and then add your choice of tempura, pay, and then pick a seat. Seating can be tricky, but we were able to find a seat inside. I'd suggest bringing a jacket in case it fills up inside, there's outdoor seating too. Overall the food was super yummy! The udon is unlike any other udon dish I've tried elsewhere. Definitely going back!
author: Linda L.

description: First time here. Enjoyed the curry udon and loved the toppings bar. After ordering your main dish there's individual items you can grab and add to your order. Long lines but it does go by quickly!!  Will come back and bring my udon loving son!
author: izzie c.

description:
Udon was excellent. Curry sauce very tasty, appropriately sweet and mildly spicy. Not a lot of beef -- would add extra beef or an egg if you need real protein. 

Tempura was soggy. Most disappointing -- for $1.90 per piece it should be crispy!

45 min wait on a Thursday night. Would definitely go back but am hoping for some quality control next time.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
First off, it's a blessing to even have this place in the city. Its not comparable to the Hawaii location but granted it's the soft opening so everything may work itself out. The soup base is much more oily than the other location but the noddles fair with Hawaii's location. The tempura were way too oily also the onigiris were almost empty of what they were supose to be filled with. Hope it's just one if those kinks that they work out and not trying to to make quick buck. Overall, I would still go back and see if everything is sorted out.

Went back recently. Everything is perfect now.
author: Herb L.

description: Soup is lukewarm. Pretty disappointing. Too bad since the noodles were good. Argh. Was so looking forward to nostalgic memories of marukame
author: A L.

description:
I visited on a Sunday at 2pm in the afternoon and the wait was still well over an hour. Worth the wait? Definitely not, but the food itself was good.

Unfortunately, if you've ever visited Japan, this style of udon restaurant is basically in every single mall in the country. You can think of it as a foodcourt staple similar to Panda Express in America... not that I'm saying there's something bad about the food, but that it's a very common offering and nothing too special about it. But this location is so swamped that the wait is long and the line moves slow, so by the time you actually sit down to eat your noodles they've already become soggy and your tempura luke warm.

Hopefully the hype dies down a bit, so the wait is not as long and the food can be enjoyed the way it should be. This is more of an excellent on-the-go type meal for me, not a 1 hour+ wait.
author: Mack S.

description: i like this place haha. i like the concept of looking at your food being made. the couple times i've been here, the line wasn't too long and i waited only 15 mins. i usually just get the regular udon and soup and get zucchini tempura and a rice ball. it's super fulling so that's all i get haha. everything was hot when i got it so that was a plus. can't wait to come here again when there isn't a long wait anymore!!
author: diane d.

description: That was NOT MARUGAME Udon, udon was just too soft and soup was as not hot enough. Hmmm
author: Tomoko A.

description:
Here, in San Francisco you will find a line at Marugame Udon.  Marugame Udon has a couple of locations, which in my experience had a variety of waiting times.  The Los Angeles one there was no line, the Hawaii one had a long, but shorter line, and for this location, since it is at a mall this was the longest line for Marugame Udon I've ever seen.  Of course, I've stood in the line though because this is five star udon.  

I always get the regular Nikutama Udon. It's simple, flavorful and delicious plus the size is pretty generous especially for the price.  The Nikutama Udon order will come with the broth, noodles, meat and the egg.  You can add green onions and tempura toppings at the end, and man do I add that up.  I can never get the right balance of toppings, but one day.  

Otherwise, you can also get tempura and onigiris at the end, but be careful, because that's how you rack up the bill and since the size of the regular is already pretty generous it might be difficult to finish all of the tempura you pick up.  What'll happen is that you'll spend money on food you won't even finish and at least for me, tempura is gross as a cold leftover.  So be careful what you pick up at the end!  That's where they get you, especially because you've been waiting in line for so long haha.  

For me, five stars since I fervently love Marugame's udon with its generous portion size and affordable prices.  But!  Be warned, the line is long and be careful not to pick up too much tempura/onigiris once you get to the end.
author: Cristina C.

description: The best udon I've ever had!!!! I got the spicy chicken udon and I wasn't expecting anything too amazing since it was so hyped. The broth was sooooo delicious and I love how they have the station for green onions, cilantro and sauce. I also liked how quickly it was to get the food. The udon was made to order in about 1-2 minutes and you can grab the extra sides as you move along in line. Would definitely come back!! Maybe when it's not as busy because you do have to wait in line outdoors in the cold. All the workers were super nice and respectful too!!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Average udon. Not much flavor. Maybe I just don't like udon that much. Don't get why all the hype.
author: Nicole P.

description: First time checking this out. Everyone said it's like the one in Hawaii Waikiki area, Marukame. I think similar in the idea of set up maybe more so. Came before it opened at 11 around 10:45 on a Saturday. Was able to find parking okay in the mall parking lot. A lot of people were waiting already for it to open. Went to the front of the store area and the lady there said the line was over in the middle of the sidewalk closer to Olive Garden by some trees. It reminded me of going to Disneyland and going through lines and zig zagging till you got to the front for the ride. So we waited at the end of the second line and it took us 45 minutes to finish the first line. Took us 36 minutes to finish the second line to just get into the door but still in line. Had to wait a while because they ran out of beef for our udon. Ordered the large beef udon. They put 2 servings of noodles into it. The broth though they didn't put enough in husband's and mine was okay. He tried the fried chicken and I had the shrimp tempura. Think it takes them a while to serve the food while in line that there's usually seats open already. Didn't like the short back chairs because people kept bumping into me and I felt like I was going to fall off. I like that they had a condiment station for the onions, krispies, and sauces as well as utensils. Water cups by the soda dispenser. Next to that is where you bus your trays to. The noodles were tasty. Beef was a good amount, a little on the chewy side. Not as sweet or soft as Hawaii Marukame. The chicken and shrimp were tasty. Would definitely come here again! A lot closer than Hawaii  If you want good freshly made udon, it's a good place to check out but have patience to wait in line.
author: Helena C.

description: If you enjoy just eating noddle this is the perfect place for you. However if you want meat this is a terrible place to come to. I got the Curry Udon bowl and got two pieces of meat and the rest was noddle. The one great thing about this place was their customer service, the people working here was very friendly.
author: James H.

description: THIS. PLACE. IS. AWESOME! I'm so glad they opened a location in SF because the one in Hawaii was sooooo goood. My boyfriend and I came to the soft opening, so the menu was limited but it was still GREAT! We both ordered the beef udon and added a couple tempuras: shrimp, zucchini, asparagus, and fish cake. Can't wait to come back and try the other soups!!
author: Michelle T.

description: My boyfriend and I got there at 10:30 on a Sunday and there was already a line. We waited for about 45 minutes total once we got in. But let me just say that I would wait an hour for their food every time if I had to... ok well not in the cold like these other yelpers have lol. It was sunny and wasn't too bad when we waited.  We thought the quality and taste of their soup was just like the one in Hawaii! I got the #2 sweet beef with egg and my boyfriend got the curry udon. We both kept constantly eating off each other's soup because they were both just so good and flavorful. Next time I want to try the spicy chicken. We'll probably get those 3 bowls next time to share haha.
author: Monaliza Z.

description: Value for money. That's what you get when you go to monogram it will done. The line is a little long around lunchtime but it is worth the wait. While you wait, you can see udon noodles being made. When you make a selection, you can choose a variety of other things to add, like shrimp tempura. If you want onigiri, they have that too.If you've ever been to Japan you'll enjoy eating at this place. They did a good job of bringing a taste of Japan over to San Francisco.
author: Fred M.

description: Decided to try this spot on a cold, rainy afternoon. Walked up and there was already a line out the door. Apparently the day I went was the grand opening (1/18/18). I like the concept because you grab a tray and they make your food to order. They also have a variety of different tempura and masubis to choose from. I ordered the spicy chicken udon and got a shrimp tempura and crab meat masubi to go with it. You definitely don't need to add any spice to the spicy chicken udon because it was pretty spicy haha. The tempura was good and the batter on it was perfect. The masubi on the other hand was ehh...it really didn't have a lot of crab meat which was a bit of a disappointment. Other than the masubi I'll definitely be back to try the other soups!!
author: Bobbee C.

description: My friend and I have been trying to go here for weeks but there was always a long line. Finally we had an opportunity to eat here and I must say the freshly made Udon noodles was off the hook. They had vegetarian alternatives which was nice,  tempura was decent., and the price is not bad
author: Nerdy G.

description: Favorite udon place hands down  I ordered a Large and Hot Nikutama udon, which is beef and egg, they got a tempura station right ahead after receiving your noodles, a bit pricey but still really delicious with the soup, really good place to eat at with friends.
author: William G.

description: Decided to come here on a whim and dragged my friends to join me after I hyped it up. It strongly reminds me of the restaurant in Oahu called Marukame. It works like a Chipotle style-ish place, where you choose your base noodle dish and then add on any tempura / masubi at the end. They even had a helpful board to show people how it works near the door. I chose the beef udon and it was a light kake broth to balance out the soft but carby noodles. The meat was tender and very thin, but good flavor. I tried my friends curry udon and it's a tiny bit spicy with a much heavier broth, but not overpowering. I'd choose the curry over the beef if I was more hungry but I wanted something less heavy. Masubi didn't have much filling and more rice: filling ratio. I'd skip it next time. Tempura has a flaky coating and I tried the vegetable one, which has a lot of onion. I don't think I'd get that one again since it's kind of big and I was stuffed silly, but it was tasty. The staff was super attentive at the soft opening and turnover with the tables was quick so staying in line was fairly fast in comparison to ramen places. I'll definitely be back and try out their full menu.
author: Kris T.

description: New place, so have to check it out. Place looks pretty clean. I think it's sort of like fast food udon. Place recently opened, so there can be quite a long line for dinner. Went around 4:30pm on a Tuesday. Line wasn't too long. Line kind of moves at a snails pace because you order your udon bowl, the guy boils the udon and adds the soup and other items, then you proceed to the side dishes area (pick what you want) and then pay at the register. I got the beef udon, a couple pieces of shrimp tempura and a salmon rice triangle. There is indoor and outdoor seating. When I went, there was plenty of seating available. Table turnover is reasonable because you aren't waiting for your food and it doesn't take that long to eat. I thought my udon was fairly tasty and the price was reasonable. I'd visit again if the line isn't too long.
author: Ronald C.

description: Huge disappointment.  Can't explain this place's popularity other than the name association with a Japanese chain.  I've been curious to try, and came here on a weekday at 11 am against my barber's warning.  Should have listened to him.  Come here if you enjoy lukewarm broth, soggy tempura under heat lamp AND waiting in a long line.  By the time I got to my table (outside, as indoor tables were all taken), the lukewarm soup was now cold.  Mushy tempura pieces were on the pricey side.  Seems like a wrong business model.  Good broth is so essential, so I don't see how (once the novelty of do it yourself udon wears off) they can have repeat customers.
author: Kern S.

description: 3rd time coming here and it just gets better and better! Quality of the food shows excellent progress from the initial opening and they are much more efficient at bringing out tempura, cooking noodles and closing out orders. Will be back!
author: Brandon L.

description: The tempura is cold and the tempura sauce takes like water with a bit of flavor. Too deluded. The lines are always long on the weekends. The quality of this place is going down. I regret buying the 10 for 10 tempura deal because most of my tempura was cold that means it been sitting out there for a while. The udon is okay. They can use chopsticks instead of their hands to put the chicken in the udon bowls , then they wouldn't have grease when touching other peoples bowls. I'm not coming here anymore. The quality of this place has gone down and nobody really has time to care
author: Russell T.

description: Food is getting better and better each week, but they need to hire professional line cooks. The college students working there are too slow. Always empty seats the the line is 2 sections long.
author: Yvette E.

description: The udon has a consistent bite. Soup is on the saltier side for my taste. Tonkatsu and spicy chicken are my favorites. Simple concept. Lines a bit long took us about 45 mins wait, order and finally enjoy our meal. At least you know you are getting fresh noodles and tempura.
author: Deanna L.

description:
Sooo very excited that Marugame is now in SF!  I've been to the one in Oahu several times and loved it!  My second time here at the SF location and enjoyed every bit of it.  I usually get the usual kake udon with tempura veggies, shrimp and chicken on the side.  It hits the spot every time.  I also love that this location has a station for all the fixings (green onion, cilantro, tempura pieces, sauces,chili powders,etc.).  

I also love that they allow for to go orders.  My only suggestion is please get plastic containers for the udon noodles and broth.  The paper container for the broth leaks and udon noodles gets stuck to the container.  The hubby left the udon noodles in the paper container overnight and the noodles were stuck to the container.  When I tried peeling off the noodles from the container chunks of paper from the container were stuck to the noodles.  I had to throw a lot of the noodles away which was a waste.  

Lastly, the lines are always long so plan on waiting in line for a good hour.
author: Angela M.

description: beware fellow diners. we ordered tonkotsu udon. it came without egg and 2 tiny pieces of pork. actually asked server, is this all? she said 'yes'. didn't realize no egg until we finished eating. walking out, saw menu picture. server mistaken. cashier mistaken. we even gave them tip at self-serve eatery. we've eaten marugame in japan. never this type of amateur mistake. make sure you get what you ordered !!
author: aina t.

description:
The place is clean, staffs are friendly, food is reasonably good, decor is nice, and price is cheaper than most places that have half the quality...  I would give it 4 stars, but seeing so many reviewers complains about the tiniest things, I have to give it a five star just be fair.
Most people don't know how hard and difficult it is to run a restaurant business in SF. One yelper even complaint there's a tip section. while they have to bust their own dishes... The tip is not mandatory, and it's not too much to ask for to show a little appreciation to the staffs who prepare your food, and put a smile on their faces while all you do is complain.
author: Tim R.

description: Good udon. I like how the tempura is cheap! Just come early cause you will be waiting!!!
author: Phuong N.

description: I'm super ecstatic that this opened in sf. I have been to their Honolulu branch and it's excellent. The one in sf is not bad for soft opening. The tempura is too greasy as compared to the one in Honolulu. Then the line moves too slow. The udon and soup base are very similar to the one in Honolulu. Hopefully they will improve after their official opening. Line needs to move faster. Tempura needs to be less greasy. More seats are needed. The staff are very nice no complains there.
author: Melissa C.

description: I went to the soft opening for this place around 8pm one night and ended up waiting about 1.5 hours, which is extremely ridiculous. It was definitely not worth the wait, I'd wait maybe about 30 minutes most for this place. I'm not saying the udon wasn't good because it was and I enjoyed it, but for something so simple, a long wait is just not worth it. I'll definitely have to go back when it's less crowded and I'll probably like it more. The udon pieces by itself are cheap but can get really expensive depending on how many a la cart items you add. I got the curry udon when I went and was a little disappointed that it wasn't more soupy, it was just curry sauce with udon basically. The next time I find myself here I will definitely try something else (especially since the full menu is available now).
author: Tori C.

description: Just like Hawaii... I got excited when I saw the sign. I went for New Years Eve to have toshikoshi soba with the family during their soft opening. They had good udon and customer service for just opening. Definitely coming back very soon!!
author: A K.

description: I had lunch here during the soft opening with my girlfriend on New Year's Day. Honestly, I don't see why there is such a big hype for this place. The tempura was pretty basic and the udon wasn't that special either... No satisfaction with any of the food and a terrible way to start off the new year!
author: Andre S.

description: Disgusting food. It would have been nice if you advertised that your broths are ALL fish based before it was my turn in that ginormous line. Im allergic.
author: Ariel S.

description:
One of our favorite spots in Waikiki is Marukame Udon, so when we heard there was one opening in SF we were excited. We are during the soft opening, so the entire menu was not available. I'll rate the restaurant on the items I ordered. 

The wait wasn't too bad for the Bay Area, 45 mins at 1:30pm on a weekday. I was able to confirm with an employee that this is the same restaurant as the one in Waikiki, even with the slightly different spelling. I ordered a large curry udon with chicken kaarage. The curry udon was spot on, good flavor and not too thick. There was a decent amount of beef in the curry to add texture and flavor. I did have concerns about the chicken kaarage, as it is made with white meat (Waikiki used dark meat). To my pleasant surprise it was juicy, but the crust fell off after the first bite.

Overall a good experience, my only gripe is the chicken kaarage should be made with dark meat since it results in a more flavorful dish. I will revise my review when I get to enjoy their full menu - complete with the soft-boiled egg.
author: Nam L.

description: This place is probably one of my favorite udon place ever. You might line up for over an hour for it if you have the time to do that, but I think it's definitely worth it. I got the Beef Udon, and the udon is very fresh. Overall, this one of my favorite place to go to.
author: Kelvin L.

description: My first time coming was a great experience especially trying it after going to a place similar in Honolulu, it was a great experience to taste the delicious udon again. After school me and my buddy decided to come again, the udon was great, but I was very disappointed to see my sweet potato tempura had raw flour I'm hoping it was only mine that wasn't fully friend because I did not have a pleasant day after taking a few bites of the raw flour, I ended up having a stomachache for the rest of that day. I would double check my tempura next time in case of raw flour.
author: Daniel W.

description: Saw this place on my friend's Snapchat and I wanted to go as soon as I saw it! I tried once before I went to class at SFSU but the line was ridiculous so I had to come back another time. I went this past Monday and it was such a cool experience! You go in and take a quick look at the menu and then you go in and tell them what you want. You see the noodles freshly made in front of you and they give you that and what I chose (beef and egg udon) and then the rest is self serve! You can choose from many different options of tempura and then then different kinds of onigiri. Price is fair but can add up after the add ons (tempura $1.50 each) but I think it was worth it and I'd definitely come back
author: Iezaic U.

description: The wait was not bad for Saturday evening.  The line looks long but went by fast.  We waited for a total of 35mins.  The udon was freshly made and very good.  We had six people and was able to get a table after we picked out our food.  I had #2 and was good, I thought it was a little sweet in the meet but overall was good.  Two of my younger kids had the plain udon, they liked it.  They had them before. And the other two has spicy chicken and also both like it.  My wife had curry, not spicy but has curry flavored.  The tuna rice balls were ok, spicy was better.  The fried chicken was a little dried but shrimp was good.
author: Hugh D.

description: The restaurant is still in its soft opening. There is a line, you'll get a coupon while you wait in line for a free piece of shrimp or chicken tempura with udon. They only have a limited menu of 3 udons at the moment. The quality and style is just like the location in Waikiki. Tasty, affordably priced, must try some masubi.
author: Spoon G.

description: Honestly it's pretty good for the price! I can with a luggage and the owner of the store kept it for me while I was eating! The udon is customizable with the garnish and sauce bar. I got high school vibes when I went there.
author: Raymond H.

description: I don't understand the hype of this.  Maybe the one in Hawaii is darn good but I am not fond of this one at stonestown.   There's nothing wow factor in its udon. We ordered #1, 3, and 4.  The curry was too thick. The udon was long and chewy but honestly its the same to me at any other restaurant.  The sides are expensive.  The only thing I can say it's too was the shrimp tempura. Its flavorful and fresh.   It has that authentic taste to it.  The tempura sauce however was lack of flavor.   The tables were the worst!  Some of the tables are either broken or maybe the floor was even.  You get a wobbling table when eating soup udon just isn't doable.  Hope they can fix it.  The people who prep the food have hat but those female workers just wear it as if an accessory   Their hair was still flying out in their pony tail etc.  I thought all hair should be covered inside the hat.
author: Janita s.

description: Line is extremely long due to the ordering process. You get to choose your food then they make it in front of you but what if there's these indecisive people in line. Maybe people just here for the experience. Anyways Definitely try the beef udon, yum yum !!
author: Blue B.

description: Everything was good. Excellent value, only the tempura could get better. Simple cafeteria style of getting food and clean tables.
author: Simon T.

description: Came here during the soft opening and was pleasantly surprised by how atmospheric the whole restaurant was and the decent pricing. Once you're inside, ordering the food is actually quite quick. I ordered the large curry udon which tasted delicious, but most importantly, authentic. I love how you can choose your own tempura and condiments here, which makes the whole eating experience really enjoyable. Overall, I highly recommend giving Marugame Udon a try.
author: Vivian C.

description: This place makes a good bowl of udon. This really hits the spot on a cold and foggy day in San Francisco. This is similar to Marukame Udon in Hawaii. The prices are decent and the food has good flavor. I wish there was more available seating for this place though. Too bad the wait time to get in is so long. Try coming here during an off peak time to avoid the rush.
author: Marty M.

description: Our second visit was pretty disappointing.  Ordered a size large bowl and it comes with two small ladles of broth....not even enough to cover the noodles.  When I asked for more broth they said each extra ladle would be an extra charge.  By the time we sat down which was immediately after paying, the soup was cold which meant it probably wasn't even hot to begin with.  The batter on the karaage and tempura just do not taste the same as the original.  The Honolulu location is still better....
author: shiella l.

description: The food was not worth the wait, I came on a friday night around 7 and got my food at 8:30. The people were nice but the quality wasn't so great. You could EASILY make this at home for cheaper.
author: Juno C.

description: We came here for their soft opening. The wait was about 35 minutes. In my opinion, it was totally worth it! I got the kake udon and it was light and not too salty. You can add green onions and fried onions as garnish to your liking. I loved that because the dish wasn't over saturated with ingredients and you could add everything to taste. Also, the noodles were SUPER fresh- we saw them being made right in front of us! The tempura was good too- lots of options. Everything was inexpensive and I would definitely come back.
author: Rebecca L.

description: I came to the soft opening and it's amazing. Come early! I was here 30 minutes before the opening and there was already a line. It's unlike any other noodle joint you would go to. Here, it's kind of like a serve yourself style. You start off with a simple bowl of soup and noodles and you add other foods to it along the way. It's yummy and I'll be back!
author: Jayla F.

description: This place is very popular, rightly so, as the food is amazing and worth the wait. My first time here, I waited for about 30 minutes and got the beef udon. You can see the udon being made as you walk into the store. The beef was delicious and the udon is fresh
author: Lisa C.

description: Very good food, service was a little fast, but still bearable. I like not expensive prices. Will come with friends again.
author: Dennis P.

description: I usually get the edamame salsa udon because I can make it vegan and it's awesome, however,  it would be cool to have a hot udon vegan option! :)
author: D S.

description:
I was so excited that I could have the authentic udon and tempura I had had in Hawaii. But, I was disappointed a lot. Pls, forget about Hawaii udon and tempura. 

1. Food was overall salty - I had curry udon, it was salty. I asked a cup of hot water. The cashier said there was no hot water to give.  I had four different kinds of tempura- not crispy but grease, 

2. As of my memory, there were two persons on the floor in Hawaii to clean the table and the floor right after, but there was nobody to do it here so the table was not clean. The cashier was the only one to take money and answer the questions so that she was too busy and that she wasn't properly trained for the cash machine.
author: Jisun M.

description: Exactly the same in Waikiki! I am sure it will get better on the day of its opening on January 18, 2018. But you have to be prepared to wait for a long time... lines are always long! I am glad they opened one in San Francisco!
author: Harold J.

description: Generous portions, good quality, and great price! You can easily feed 2 people for less that $20, and the tempura/rice ball section gives a good variety.
author: Sam A.

description: Prices were great, but quality was a huge disappointment. The food was luke warm and tasted similar if not the same as packaged instant udon. Felt a bit gross afterward. Also disappointing was they charge extra for another ladle of broth...BROTH.
author: Jay L.

description: Nommy udon, but the tempura was poor quality. Overbattered and not fresh made to order, so tasted stale AF. Definitely not worth the wait. Overhyped.
author: Jason Y.

description: It wasn't worth the wait unfortunately, I had indigestion due to greasy add-ons, broth wasn't hot enough, I recommend take digestive enzymes to break down your intake. Customer service was excellent tho'
author: Mariel C.

description: The wife and kids have been wanting to eat here since it opened. We have been to the one in waikiki a few times where luckily only about 10 groups  before us. They loved the food and experience there. The line here is usually out to the parking lot so I have been able to delay this meal for months. We were shopping at the mall one weekend when I get a call saying hurry to the restaurant because they're in line and almost at the door. By the time I walk over there's still about 4 groups ahead of us. We get our orders and all the supposedly hot soups are just warm. They are all disappointed and now want to wait until we go to waikiki again. Thank you!
author: Rus C.

description: Love the Honolulu location, so happy that they made one in San Francisco! The shrimp tempura is sooo good when it's fresh. Really good quality fresh noodles, but at times I've gotten a lukewarm bowl of soup :( for the long wait, everything should be hot!
author: Jessica W.

description: The line wasn't very long when I went so I'm giving this 5 stars. Waiting in line for about 15 minutes. I've never had MARUGAME Udon and I love noodles so I was super excited. The noodles were perfectly cooked.
author: J K.

description: Long line, not worth the hype.  Toppings were expensive.  Lots of msg or salt that left me thirsty all night.
author: T Y.

description: There's always a long line here, but the food is only average in terms of Udon. There are better restaurants with fresh noodles and better prices in San Francisco
author: Wilson W.

description: Marugame in Japan is way better. Here, soup is not hot, green onion should be cut into thinner slices, and the waiting line is always so long due to slow service.
author: Kenny P.

description: Good udon. I got the curry udon which was delish. I'm going to try the beef and spicy chicken next time and update my review. Sides are about average. Tempura is very nicely battered but it's like any other tempura you get. The masubi was prob my least favorite. Tastes like basic rice and the fake crab meat in California rolls. I agree with the reviews... all the masubi has very little meat. It's like a rice ball with one slice of seaweed. Rice definitely over powers everything. Just dip it in soy sauce for your flavor.... or dump it into your udon
author: Donna L.

description:
Muragame Udon you should stay exclusively in Hawaii.  The Stonestown site cannot compete.  It is just not the same.  I will say the employees are the best thing about it.  Very welcoming as soon as I walked through the door.  The first person explained how it was the soft opening so the menu was limited.  The second person told me all about the concept and how to do the ordering by picking the type of udon you wanted and moving  down the line to pick the tempura and musubis you wanted.  I didn't want to interrupt her by saying I've been to the Honolulu site many, many times.  She was doing such a good job at explaining.  The floor manager that first night was very attentive by clearing tables, finding people seats and clearing your tray for you.
The food is a different story.  I will say the udon was al dente but the broth was just warm.  The tempura was cold.  What an oily disappointment. I think it sat out too long because there wasn't much turnover in customers yet, even though I came around 6:45. Or was it leftover from lunch? I will say the potato coquettes were very good.  I always like a good coquette.   The condiment cart was well stocked but the tempura pieces were not crispy and another greasy mess.  
I think I'll stick to the Murakame Udon in Hawaii.  At least it's warmer there in food and weather!
author: lori l.

description: Been here several already cause its really good and affordable. If you come for early dinner line or wait is not bad. Beef Udon is my favorite!
author: Jami F.

description: Although the line looked daunting, we only waited about 20 minutes before we were able to sit down to eat on a weekday at 1pm. The noodles were cooked perfectly.  I liked being able to dress my own bowl with copious amounts of ginger, cilantro, and scallions.  I also really enjoyed the salmon onigiri.  The one downside, the soup could've been hotter.
author: T T.

description:
Never had the original Margugame udon at HI, so maybe that's why I was taken back by the taste. I was thinking it would've been more of the udon flavors found at your sushi spot, but I was wrong.
I ordered the #2 because I wanted an egg in my udon mainly. If you like your meat sweet, then this place is definitely for you. Unfortunately, I do not like sweet meat in my bowl of noodles, which is why one star is docked. 
We went on a night where it was pretty blustery and light drizzle and the line was getting out the door. One of the staff advised all the customers in line that due to fire code, the line would have to be moved outside....in the rain...in the cold.... I thought they should've been better prepared and not kick people outside, but I understand it's for safety reasons, but still the way he announced it was off putting.
The interior itself is like a cafeteria, you order your noodles and sides and sit down at any open space. I was a bit apprehensive because seating was limited and there were hella people still eating and in line. But it worked out because people just eat and leave.
All in all, if you like sweet udon, this is your place, if not, then you've been warned.
author: Theresa S.

description: The food was okay, considering the line.... there were more choices of fried food than there were udon but it was nice trying it for the first time~
author: Princess K.

description:
Totally love this Udon shop! 
The hype is real, this udon shop is totally excellent! 
Located at the entrance of Stonetown Mall, where parking is abundant, this new restaurant is always busy. I have been here many times, and there is a line each time. But it moves fast. I wait around 30 minutes, which is not bad at all. But I don't like the fact that one person can be in line, then at the last minute, friends and family join him/her. 
While waiting in line, I can watch the employees make the noodles in the front of the shop. Then it's time to order. Choose the size, and type of meat and broth. Since I love the assorted tempura, I always go for the clear broth, but I have tried the beef and also the curry. There are plenty of staff working, so the tempura is always hot. And after paying, there is a self help station to add toppings like scallions, cilantro, ginger... The main reason I love this place is the udon is the perfect consistency of chewiness, and the broth perfectly seasoned. I have been to the one in Hawaii, and it tastes as good! 
Even though it is always busy, there will be a seat available when i get my bowl of udon. This is the kind of place people eat and leave, and not hanging around to chit chat. 
A nice addition to Stonetown mall!
author: lovetoeat a.

description: Love this place.  Dont let the lines fool you.  It moves very quickly.  If you get there at 5pm there is no line.  Wonderful place and reminds me of Hawaii.
author: dan r.

description:
We were super excited that a Marugame was opening t
In the city! We ordered the spicy chicken udon and the curry udon. The broth in the spicy chicken udon had too much lime added to it which made it really sour. The curry was ok, but not spectacular in flavor. The texture of the udon had a good bite to it , which makes this Marugame promising after a few more months of being open. I feel that with practice and experience, the food will be just as good as the one in Hawaii. We also ordered a bunch of tempura- chicken, shrimp, vegetable ball, etc. But it was also disappointing because the chicken was overly battered and the other tempura pieces were limp, not crispy, and overly oily. The lines were long when we got there around 5:15, but like all good places, you just have to wait. But after going through the whole experience of ordering food, waiting, paying, and getting a table, I feel the biggest problem is the efficiency of the staff. I will give this place a few more months before trying it again. Hopefully there will be improvement.
author: Chocolate P.

description: Been to the one in Waikiki many times and it's a well oiled machine. Tried coming here 2 times in one week and the first time, the restaurant was closed on Easter Sunday cause their machines were broken. Then tried coming again at 11am on Saturday and they said they weren't opening until 1pm. This is not the way to run a business, no matter how good it may be.  Suggest eating elsewhere until they decide to be professional.
author: Kevin T.

description: I wasn't going to write this review, but feel like I need to in case this happened or happens to anyone else. We ate here a few weeks ago and I had an odd allergic reaction to something I had (and I have no known food allergies).  After a few minutes into eating my spicy chicken udon my upper lip started to feel funny like I got bit or something.  Then I felt it starting to get bigger and I knew something was wrong.  Something inside me told me to stop eating right then and there so we packed up and left. By the time we got to the car my lip was HUGE. Not sure if it was MSG (if they use it) or what but I definitely had a reaction to something and it felt like I was going to get hives.  I also read another review about someone getting hives, so if this happens to you please share your experience. The food was pretty average in my opinion, but with the above said I'll have to say that I won't ever go back again.  Sorry, but this place is way overrated...
author: Jesus H.

description: Kake soup base out of expectation, warm only, not hot enough, taste fair; good price though
author: Wai K.

description: being vegetarian, the edamame salsa is the only option for me, but it's good. The TVP it comes with is spicy (a problem for me), but it's good. I really liked the a la carte tempura. Don't come during peak hours, I saw people waiting outside in the rain on a Friday at 2pm. Would be nice if they added a veggie broth option. I didn't want to hold up the line asking about all the others, but I'm assuming the others had dashi or animal stock since they didn't have the leaf icon on the menu like the edamame did.
author: Nick V.

description: Ordered a large spicy chicken with sweet potato tempura and veggie tempura. Everything was so good. Very stuffed. Would definitely come back again
author: Liana L.

description: I had this Udo in Hawaii, and this one in San Francisco kind of a disappointment to me. Comparing to the one in Hawaii, The soup is not rich, the side dish is a little bit different. May be I had good experience on Hawaii, so I have higher exception on this one.
author: Timmy J.

description: Not as good as hawaii. Although they're friendly they're very slow and inefficient, especially with take out. We had to wait in the regular line for 30 min just for a to go order!
author: Josephine L.

description: Good cleanliness. You are responsible for your own bowl to be put away and they have a side bar where you can put your own toppings. Includes cilantro, green onions, sauces and also tempura. If I was anyone new going there again, I would advise anyone to beware of the sides that they provide which can the boost the price of your meal. Overall, great place!
author: Marc B.

description: Long lines, but we got there at 4pm, so the wait wasn't as long as during their peak hours.  It was actually short when we saw how the line looked after we ate!  It took us about 20 mins to order.  I got the egg drop chicken udon, my bf had the curry udon and my daughter got the kama-age udon.  I must say the texture of the noodles were excellent.  You can see them putting the dough into the machine and cooking the noodles in batches as you wait in line before ordering.  It's fresh as can be!  My bf didn't care for the curry sauce though.  He liked the noodles, but expected more meat in the curry like the picture.  He got tiny bits and pieces of meat.  I guess I expected what I got though after eating it, I think I would have preferred a clear broth instead.  My daughter basically had plain noodles in water with dipping sauce.  She was fine with that and ate it up!  And she usually doesn't eat that much, so that was good for her.  Now after eating there, I was very thirsty a few hours later.  Too much MSG used in the sauce?  I didn't eat anything else that was salty that day, so maybe too much sodium in something.  With the long lines, we're not sure if we'll be back anytime soon.  Maybe if the lines die down, we'll go back and try one of the clear broth udon noodle soup or get the plain noodles instead.
author: A. C.

description: Good stuff first time experiences. Do admit the curry I ordered is a bit salty, everything else are great besides. Customer services... etc just long lines, be prepared to wait... will worth it tho. Go with the large bowl, (they provided container for Togo) since it's only $1 more ;)
author: Wai C.

description: Some items were a little salty. Don't recommend the spicy chicken udon. Overall good but not worth waiting over a hour...
author: Jeannette L.

description: I really don't know why people line up for this place. The supposedly hot udon is actually lukewarm and the soup is way too salty. The tempura is cold and the crust is too thick. Nothing I ate there is good. I am so disappointed!!! I will not go back there for sure. Not worth lining up for!!
author: Janny H.

description: Great place!!! Loved it!! You won't be disappointed....Bring all of your friends and make it a night out! Excellent service, too!
author: Kelli R.

description: The soup isn't hot enough, just warm! The spring eggs doesn't be just cracked and done in the super hot soup. That's why they prepared the Spring eggs in the cold water. It tastes good, but not as good as the one in Honolulu, Hawaii! If you have try it at the other location, you may be very disappointed.
author: Tang J.

description: This place was eh-ok, I think what just made it ok for me was because the wait was extremely long. Maybe when the hype dies down I will give it another try. But the food was not worth the long wait. Especially, when it is freezing outside!
author: Jennifer R.

description: I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. The best bowl of udon noodles I have ever had. I've been here once a week since they've opened. Noodles are maximum chewiness because they are made fresh and there are a lot of flavors to choose from. To top it off, the staff is exceptionally friendly and hard-working! Marugimme those udon noodles now!
author: Jessica L.

description: This place got great cheap udon! I highly recommend the curry udon but honestly all of them are really good too. The line can get long but the udon is well worth the wait.
author: Chris K.

description: Simple and great. Chewy udon. Fair price. Will visit often if the line is not that long.
author: Wendy H.

description: My friend wanted to try this place.  Wait is too long.  Food is very fresh.  Everything else is standard.
author: HQ S.

description: Ate here with friends today.This place is good and have positive energy. Pretty busy for dinner but I did expect a bit better. The food was salty and the tempura gave me a bit of a headache after. The main food I ordered was Nikatuma Udon. The portion of the food was  large. It was a lot of food. If your planning to get tempura and other sides, get a regular size. The food was good but I wasnt sure if I was eating udon or bowl of salt.
author: Michelle N.

description: I have been to Marukame in Hawaii and it was amazing there, so I was excited to hear that they were opening one in SF. I got the Nikutama cold with shrimp tempura and tuna mayo rice ball. It was good, however I do wish they gave more broth. I ask the person in the front for more, however they said they only give a little because the broth is salty which I don't understand because I ordered the same thing in Hawaii as well. Perhaps different location, different recipes?? Either way, it was still good. I don't recommend the rice ball because honestly it was 85% rice than tuna. The ones in Hawaii were definitely better. This place is self-serve so you order first and pay afterwards. Remember to bust your own tables as well! Overall, I would come back if I didn't have to wait in line.
author: Jenny H.

description: Service is very quick, food is great, workers are fantastic, and the place is clean. Will be going for lunch more often.
author: Jacob L.

description: omg so good. beware, there is no egg yet. they will have em when they have their offcial opening on 1/18 so make sure you prepare beforehand. pro tip: get the large. jacqy says hi !
author: Thomas L.

description: lol I would give this place 4 stars, but they need another cash register lol!
author: Bree M.
